Articles.Content:
I'm looking for inspiration to make new plane (actually working on F-35) But first i want you to show your F-22's

Here's mine:

That plane is amazing, nice job!

BTW, my V-X1 was inspired by F-22, but doesn't look like it, just some similarities.

You can see it here: Foomtish!
i have made alot of replicas and seen a fair few, but this one looks very good for stock craft, this one looks better than mine. this is possibly the best stock F-22 replica.
Looks good for stock parts, I can't stand stock parts for planes, they don't handle well in FAR.

Looks good for stock parts, I can't stand stock parts for planes, they don't handle well in FAR.

If i would use FAR, then i would modify F-22 to be able to fly with FAR. But i'm building planes that people could play with them without mods. If i would modify it for FAR, then it could not fly without FAR or it would be unbalanced.

If i would use FAR, then i would modify F-22 to be able to fly with FAR. But i'm building planes that people could play with them without mods. If i would modify it for FAR, then it could not fly without FAR or it would be unbalanced.

And that is the reason I like FAR.

I want to make realistic planes. So i should make them realistic as much as i can. Because of that i should use FAR and build planes with it. But I'm creating planes for other people so they could play with them without any modifications of game. My goal is to make as much realistic plane/craft as unmodded game allow me. Building crafts for myself is boring. I can do it for one week, two weeks, but then this game become boring. Of course this game is not "creator of planes" I was on almost every planet, moon. I stopped playing it. But one time I found that creating nice crafts for other people can be fun, so I'm doing it <Sorry for grammatical and spelling errors>
I haven't made a F-22, but I have a plane inspired by one, http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/51707-AF-19B-Advanced-Fighter

Looks awesome, I haven't yet been able to build an F22 or F35 since I'm too much of a perfectionist. Do you have a download for your craft?

As for the FAR comments... People like to brag about it as if making stuff that can fly in FAR is harder. Its not harder per se, just DIFFERENT. It actually makes some things much easier and require less delta V but also makes some assemblies behave straight up WEIRD and in an unrealistic manner.

Well, not an F-22, but definitely an F-35 (mini) replica:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The KSR K-35A. All comments/criticism welcome.
